activities:
Corventis collects patient health, billing and insurance data from individuals. Patient data is collected and transmitted to a server for processing.  The purpose of this data transmission is to:
a) Facilitate patient and medical management, and 
b) Assist physicians/health practitioners in the diagnosis and identification of various clinical conditions/events/trends.
In addition, patient data may be transferred to the United States for the purpose of development and improvement of device algorithms.
General Privacy Policy, see http://www.corventis.com/docs/Corventis_Privacy.pdf.  Safe Harbor policy, see link below.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: For complaints that cannot be resolved between Corventis and the complainant, Corventis has agreed to participate in the dispute resolution procedures of the panel established by the European Data Protection Authorities (EU DPAs) to resolve disputes pursuant to the Safe Harbor Principles.  The Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) is available to investigate unresolved complaints concerning information received from Switzerland.
